content.description: Climb up a face with some thin moves to a roof. Pull the roof at a small notch, the continue up the face to the anchors.
content.location: Just right of Bushed Coyote, towards the left side of the Left Flank.

content.description: Climbs the face on the left side of the crack with the sumac bush growing out of the top.  Fun, varied, steep climbing on edges and pockets. The bolting is little bit "sporty" compared to some of the Echo moderates, but the protection is where you need it. Traverses right under the sumac to finish. Shares the anchor with Morning Glory.
content.location: This route is located just right of Wet Bush and left of the obvious crack.

content.description: Face climb to the top of the wall. Pleasant climbing that gets easier as you go up.
content.protection: 9 bolts to 2 Fixe ring anchors. Use a 60-meter rope.
content.location: This climb is the fourth climb from the right edge of the Left Flank, left of Bushwhacked (see photo).

content.description: Start behind some bushes near a hand crack. Face climb up  somewhat chossy rock to the top of the wall.
content.protection: 9 bolts to 2 rap rings over a nice big ledge. Use a 60-meter rope.
content.location: This climb is near the center of the Left Flank, right of Morning Glory (see photo).

content.description: Excellent climbing which starts on the arete, then follows a hand crack near the top. Fun moves, popular.
content.location: This route is on the nice-looking arete toward the left side of the Left Flank (see photo).

content.description: "Black Tide" ascends the prominent black water streak on the right side of the Left Flank, between "B-line" and "Espresso." Positive holds lead to a lower angle section at mid-height. Pockets and small edges on the steep black flake lead to a horizontal and stemming to reach the 2-ring Fixe anchor on the right wall. While it's not unusual to see a climber trying to stem/chimney the crease between the Left Flank and the Java Wall, the best line ascends the black streak on the face left of the crease.
content.location: "Black Tide" follows the prominent black water streak on the right side of the Left Flank between "B-line" and "Espresso."

content.description:
B-Line is a long and engaging route, featuring small pockets and positive edges. The challenges come on small pockets at the bottom and the sting at the end, clipping the anchor. The beginning and end are steep and thought provoking, with easier climbing in the middle. While it maybe tempting to TR off the anchor due to the awkward position, please use your own gear for TRing.

This route is in the shade in the morning and the late afternoon.
content.protection: 9 bolts to open shut anchors. Use a 60-meter rope.
content.location: B-Line is on the right side of the Left Flank, just left of Black Tide.
